sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
By the King a proclamation for the better direction of those who desire to repaire to the court for the cure of their disease, called, the kings euill. England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I) Charles I, King of England, 1600-1649.
1 sheet ([1] p.).
By Robert Barker, Printer to the Kings most Excellent Maiestie: And by the assignes of Iohn Bill, Imprinted at London : M.DC.XXXI [1631]
Arms without "C R" at top. "Giuen at Our Court at Whitehall, the fiue and twentieth day of March, in the sixt yeere of Our Reigne." Reproduction of original in: Society of Antiquaries.
=======
By the King a proclamation for the better direction of those who desire to repaire to the court for the cure of their disease, called, the kings euill. England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I) Charles I, King of England, 1600-1649.
1 sheet ([1] p.).
By Robert Barker, Printer to the Kings most Excellent Maiestie: And by the assignes of Iohn Bill, Imprinted at London : M.DC.XXXI [1631]
Arms without "C R" at top. "Giuen at Our Court at Whitehall, the fiue and twentieth day of March, in the sixt yeere of Our Reigne." Reproduction of original in: Society of Antiquaries.
